--- toc: false --- # Lab 3: APA References Worksheet {.unnumbered} ::: questions ## Instructions i) Now that you have learned some basic Zotero functionality, let’s practice some more. Below is a list of: DOI links that will take you to a number of different sources, some webpages, and info for other types of sources for which you will need to track down what is needed to create a Zotero entry. Note: Do NOT use the URL in the Zotero reference unless it is needed for that source type… you may be given the URL below simply because that’s how we are pointing you to the source, not necessarily because you should include the URL. For some of the sources, we have provided you with info that may lead you directly, or indirectly, to a webpage where you can’t actually access the PDF. Use what you learned in lab to track down the PDF copy (it’s actually pretty simple), if you want to have Zotero find the metadata for you instead of doing it manually! ::: ::: objectives ## For Each Numbered item - [ ] **Search**: Determine which kind of source it is and create a Zotero entry for each one (under a new collection, e.g., APA refs take home). - [ ] **Record**: Ensure that all of the necessary meta-data is entered into the right-side panel of Zotero and that capitalization etc. is correct. - [ ] **Export**: Confirm that you entered the info correctly by copy and paste-ing it into the boxes on this page - [ ] **Submit**: In Zotero, **GENERATE A REPORT FROM COLLECTION* and paste the information into the Lab 3 assignment on Canvas. ::: ::: vspace2 ::: ## Prepare for Today ::: readings - [ ] Read the [Syllabus](https://emmarshall.github.io/PSYC181-UNL/SUM24/syllabus.qmd) ::: ::: takeaways The answer is typically in the syllabus or on the site. But if it isn't, do not hesitate to reach out or set up a one-on-one meeting. ::: ::: callout-note 1) Set up Zotero: You may use Zotero on the lab computers or install Zotero on your own laptop (preferred). 2) Familiarize yourself with Zotero (walkthrough) i) Create a new collection called “\[your name\] APA references worksheet” ii) Adding your first PDF **EXAMPLE:** Perform a [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com) search for “Hicks, Humphries & Slater (2024)” `DOI:10.1007/s10676-024-09775-5` (1) Download a {{< fa file-pdf >}} copy of the article. (2) Drag & drop this file into your APA references worksheet collection in Zotero, note that metadata retrieval is automatic. Note: Adding an item to a collection automatically adds it to your library as well. (3) Click on the item that is created, and inspect the right-side info pane, what kind of info is there? (4) Using the Journal Reference Checklist handout, make sure that all of the necessary journal article reference information is present in the right-side pane. (5) Right-click on this item in your collection, select create bibliography, choose APA 7th edition, we want to output as a bibliography and copy to the clipboard. Paste the citation below (5-points) and be sure to delete the automatic numbering that Word will insert in front of it: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: callout-note ## Practice Question A 2024 Journal Article Titled "ChatGPT is bullshit" published in *Ethics and Information Technology* | The APA 7 citation is: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ### 1) Phantoms in the Brain (1st edition, paperback) {.unnumbered} ::: {.callout-tip .center collapse="true"} ## Hint If you find the book online on a site like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Phantoms-Brain-Probing-Mysteries-Human/dp/0688172172/ref=monarch_sidesheet) you can click “read sample” to find the info on the copyright page, the publisher is “HarperCollins”, the copyright date is **NOT** the date to use, we want the *publication* year ::: | The APA 7 citation is: ### 2) http://www.jneurosci.org/lookup/
doi/10.1523/JNEUROSCI.0744-19.2019 {.unnumbered} The APA 7 citation is: ### 3) Title – “Men Set Their Own Cites High: Gender and Self-citation across Fields and over Time” {.unnumbered} ::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"} ## Hint You won’t find page numbers because this journal uses an article number. This number can be hard to find so we will help you out, it is the last number in the DOI URL, 2378023117738903. In the Zotero pages field, enter “Article 2378023117738903” ::: The APA 7 citation is: ### 4) DOI: 10.1016/j.mex.2021.101545 {.unnumbered} The APA 7 citation is: ### 5) Report published in *Science* magazine on March 2008 titled *Synaptic Theory of Working Memory* {.unnumbered} The APA 7 citation is: ### 6) DOI: 10.1016/j.tics.2015.05.004 {.unnumbered} The APA 7 citation is: ### 7) The following website if visited on `August 19, 2023` https://climate.nasa.gov/vital-signs/global-temperature/ {.unnumbered} ::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"} ## Hint - For `author` – Use the **full name** and not acronym - For Be sure to distinguish between the `parent website` which is the main website, and the `URL` to where you accessed the info - The name of the page is **Global Temperature** – not “global-temperature” or “vital-signs/global-temperature” - If you cut off the sub-pages from the URL, and go to the main site climate.nasa.gov, the *upper left* of the page tells you what the *parent site* name is) ::: The APA 7 citation is: ### 8) http://doi.org/fg6rf9 {.unnumbered} ::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"} ## Hint You’re going to hate us for this one, but it’s important to test you for how to format an article with this many authors. If you try the shortcut of getting the citation from Google Scholar, it WILL be incorrect, besides… you’ll need to paste the Zotero report anyway. ::: The APA 7 citation is:
